name: Stuffed Naan
history: Stuffed Naan is a creative variation of the traditional Naan, an essential part of Indian cuisine. This version includes a delicious stuffing, adding a new dimension of flavor to the classic flatbread.
description: Stuffed Naan is a leavened flatbread filled with a variety of ingredients like spiced potatoes, paneer, or minced meat. It's made from refined flour and cooked on a tandoor or skillet, offering a delightful combination of soft bread with a flavorful filling.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let it sit for 10 minutes until frothy. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, and yogurt. Add the yeast mixture and knead into a soft dough. Cover and let it rest for 2-3 hours.

instructions.title: Make the Filling
instructions.description: Mix mashed potatoes with garam masala, cumin seeds, green chilies, and chopped cilantro.

instructions.title: Stuff and Roll the Naans
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Flatten each ball, place a portion of the filling in the center, and seal it. Roll out each stuffed ball into a flat circular shape.

instructions.title: Cook the Naans
instructions.description: Heat a tawa or skillet. Cook each naan until golden brown on both sides. Brush with melted butter or ghee.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot stuffed naans with curries, dals, or chutneys.

tips: Ensure the water is warm, not hot, to activate the yeast properly.
The dough should be soft and pliable for the best texture.
variations: Experiment with different fillings like spiced paneer, minced meat, or mixed vegetables.
Add spices like ajwain or dried fenugreek leaves to the dough for additional flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a skillet before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot skillet or tawa until warm and soft.
presentationTips: Serve on a decorative platter with a side of fresh salad or raita.
Garnish with additional butter or ghee for a rich flavor.
